title: 'Ready to hand over Asia Cup trophy': Naqvi says 'never apologised' to BCCI
content: ACC President Mohsin Naqvi fiercely refuted claims of apologising to BCCI regarding the Asia Cup trophy, accusing Indian media of "fabricated propaganda." This controversy stems from India's refusal to accept the trophy from Naqvi after their victory, citing geopolitical tensions. Reports indicate Naqvi initially avoided acknowledging India's triumph, leaving the champions without their prize and escalating the cricket-politics dispute.

title: US govt shutdown: How it may impact immigration, travel process
content: The US government shutdown has begun, creating uncertainty for immigration processes. While USCIS and most Department of State visa/passport services remain operational, the Department of Labor's Office of Foreign Labor Certification has ceased all functions. This halt prevents the filing of crucial LCAs and PERM applications, significantly delaying H-1B and green card processes until the shutdown concludes.

title: 'Moral cowardice': Cong attacks PM for backing Trump's Gaza plan - sets 4 posers
content: Jairam Ramesh criticized Prime Minister Modi for his silence on the Gaza war. He called it moral cowardice. Modi welcomed President Trump's new 20-point plan for Gaza. Congress leader Pawan Khera supported Ramesh's views. Khera emphasized the need for a Palestinian state. The plan aims for peace and security in the region. India recognized Palestine in 1988.

title: US govt shuts down: Embassy in India gives update; says X account won’t be updated until…
content: The US government has shut down for the first time in nearly seven years, as Republicans and Democrats failed to agree on federal funding. This lapse halts "non-essential" functions like visa services and national parks, while essential employees work without pay. The US Embassy in India also announced reduced updates to its X account.

title: 'Ha bhai, aa gaya swaad': BJP roasts Shaheen Afridi after India's Asia Cup title win
content: Abhishek Sharma delivered match-winning performances in the Asia Cup 2025, notably dominating Shaheen Shah Afridi. His extraordinary display earned him the Player of the Tournament award and a record-breaking 931 rating points in the ICC T20I Rankings, surpassing all previous records. The 25-year-old left-hander has firmly established himself as a top T20 batter.

title: Karur stampede fallout: TVK suspends Vijay's rallies; sets norms for key leaders
content: TVK has suspended Vijay's campaign trail across Tamil Nadu, canceling upcoming rallies and instructing district secretaries not to seek police permissions. This decision follows a stampede and legal issues, with Vijay expected to resume campaigning only by late October. Party functionaries are also advised to be cautious on social media.

title: Gold price hike: Akhilesh sees BJP hand; takes 'goldification' jab at Centre
content: Samajwadi Party president Akhilesh Yadav accused the BJP of gold hoarding. He termed this process "goldification." Yadav stated BJP leaders convert black money into gold. He linked this to rising gold prices. Yadav questioned government action on hoarders. He noted gold prices make ornaments unaffordable for many. Gold prices reached a new high in Delhi today. This impacts traditional practices.

title: Arattai vs WhatsApp: Understanding features, users, privacy and more key differences explained
content: Arattai and WhatsApp are central to India's digital communication. Arattai, a homegrown app, supports regional languages and low-end devices. WhatsApp, a global giant, offers end-to-end encryption and rich features. The article compares their performance, privacy, and business tools. Users choose based on specific needs like accessibility or global reach. Both apps offer unique strengths.

title: Gaza peace: Hamas splits over Trump's plan - key demands of terror outfit
content: Hamas is deliberating on US President Donald Trump's 20-point peace plan, seeking amendments on disarmament and expulsion of cadres, despite Trump's 3-4 day ultimatum. The group is internally divided, with some favouring unconditional approval for a ceasefire while others demand significant reservations, particularly against disarmament and legitimising occupation. Discussions are ongoing.

title: 8 sixes and death stares! Vaibhav Suryavanshi's brutal assault on Australia bowlers
content: India's 14-year-old batting sensation Vaibhav Suryavanshi smashed the fourth-fastest Youth Test century, a breathtaking 78-ball hundred against Australia U19. He also broke the record for most career sixes in Youth ODI cricket and became the youngest centurion in IPL history, winning the Super Striker award in IPL 2025.

title: Klay Thompson silent on Megan Thee Stallion, chasing Mavericks’ goal
content: Dallas Mavericks' Klay Thompson targets a historic 50/40/90 shooting season, an elite benchmark, after deflecting personal questions at media day. His ambitious individual goal, combined with Kyrie Irving's crucial return from a torn ACL, is pivotal for the Mavericks' playoff aspirations in a highly competitive Western Conference. The team's success hinges on these key performances.

title: H-1B visa fees: Jensen Huang reacts to US move; calls $100,000 charge ‘too high’
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang endorsed President Trump's H-1B visa reforms but warned the new $100,000 application fee is prohibitively expensive. He cautioned this steep cost could deter global tech talent and students, potentially driving investment away from the US. Huang stressed that attracting the "brightest minds" remains crucial for America's future, despite supporting immigration system overhaul efforts.

title: Happy Dussehra 2025: Top wishes, messages, quotes and images for Vijayadashami
content: Dussehra 2025, observed on October 2nd, marks the victory of good over evil, celebrating Lord Rama's triumph and Goddess Durga's conquest. This auspicious occasion brings families together to share heartfelt messages and participate in cultural events. The article provides heartwarming messages, inspiring quotes, and creative ideas to celebrate Dussehra with loved ones, emphasizing the importance of righteousness and virtue.

title: UP: 75-year-old man dies day after wedding; body sent for postmortem
content: A 75-year-old man in Jaunpur district married a 40-year-old widow on Monday but tragically died the following morning after a sudden health deterioration. Police are investigating the bizarre incident, and a postmortem is awaited to ascertain the cause of death and rule out any foul play. The man had remarried after his first wife's death, seeking companionship.

title: Festive cheer for central govt staff: Cabinet approves 3% DA, DR hike - details
content: Central government employees and pensioners will receive 3% hike in Dearness Allowance (DA) and Dearness Relief (DR), with Cabinet approving the hike. This biannual revision, aimed at offsetting inflation, will increase the DA/DR rate to 58%.

title: NCRB data: When crime numbers hide more than they reveal - decoded
content: Delhi is the country's crime capital with 1508.9 IPC cases per lakh population, while Jharkhand reports the fewest. However, Jharkhand's murder rate is significantly higher than Delhi's and Kerala's, suggesting widespread under-reporting of other crimes. This disparity highlights better policing and rigorous crime reporting in states like Delhi and Kerala.

title: 'I Love Muhammad' row: Encounter in Bareilly; 2 men of Tauqeer Raza held
content: UP Police arrested two associates of cleric Tauqeer Raza Khan following an encounter in Fatehganj Paschimi. The accused, Mohd Idris and Iqbal, had allegedly snatched a constable's anti-riot firearm and fired at police during a September 26 clash. Police recovered the stolen gun and other weapons, vowing continued action against those inciting unrest in Bareilly.

title: Virginia man suffers heart attack while driving, crashes at cardiologist’s office
content: A Virginia man survived a heart attack. He crashed his car outside a cardiologist's office. Dr Deepak Talreja, a heart specialist, revived him. Geraci had stopped breathing and lost pulse. His arteries showed severe blockages. Medical help arrived within eight minutes. Geraci is now recovering and changing his diet. He considers his survival a miracle.

title: Prince William, Kate face backlash over ‘no-go zone’ near Windsor home
content: Prince William and Kate Middleton’s new Windsor home is at the center of a row as a 150-acre exclusion zone closes popular routes in Windsor Great Park. Locals fear the royals are cutting off community access to public land.

title: First since 2019: US govt shuts down – Why it’s more serious this time
content: The US government has entered its first shutdown since 2019, fueled by a bitter healthcare funding clash between President Trump and Democrats. Unlike previous standoffs, the administration is threatening permanent federal job cuts to reshape the workforce, sparking widespread anger.

title: Gill hints at playing extra seamer in Ahmedabad; shares update on Bumrah
content: Team India captain Shubman Gill has hinted at playing an extra seamer in Ahmedabad’s first Test against West Indies, citing overcast conditions. He described the quick turnaround from the Asia Cup as a mental challenge and warned West Indies of “tough cricket.” Gill emphasized the importance of wickets offering opportunities for both batters and bowlers.

title: Menopause and male fertility: Do men have a reproductive expiry date too?
content: Men, too, have a biological clock impacting fertility, not just women. While sperm production continues, quality and quantity decline significantly after 40, raising risks for offspring like autism. Lifestyle, stress, and falling testosterone exacerbate this.

title: Kharge hospitalised: Son says planned pacemaker implant procedure; 83-yr-old leader stable
content: Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge was admitted to MS Ramaiah Hospital in Bengaluru for a planned pacemaker implantation and is reported stable. The 83-year-old leader, who was earlier hospitalized for fever, is scheduled to address a public rally in Kohima, Nagaland, on October 7, focusing on youth employment and good governance.

title: 'Tariffs to hit growth': RBI on impact of Trump trade war; confident of India’s resilience
content: RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra warned that US tariffs pose risks to India's economic growth, potentially decelerating it from late 2025. Despite this, the economy remains resilient, bolstered by domestic factors and GST reforms. The central bank, however, kept the repo rate unchanged at 5.5%

title: WWE legend Randy Orton caught off guard by IShowSpeed’s RKO stunt
content: Internet sensation IShowSpeed recently attempted an RKO on WWE legend Randy Orton at his "Speed Goes Pro" launch event, creating a humorous moment. This playful interaction follows their previous encounter at WrestleMania 40, where Orton delivered an RKO to Speed. The duo shared a friendly exchange, highlighting their ongoing, entertaining dynamic.

title: Boost for Tejas fleet: HAL receives 4th GE engine; $1 bn follow-on order likely in Oct
content: GE Aerospace delivered the fourth F404-IN20 engine to HAL for India's Tejas Mk1A. HAL confirmed negotiations concluded for a follow-on order of 113 F404 engines, valued over $1 billion, expected to be signed in October. This deal, alongside F414 tech transfer talks, significantly boosts India's defence indigenisation efforts.

title: Hyd actor Dimple Hayathi booked: Allegedly harassed domestic help; clothes torn, phone smashed
content: Film Nagar police registered a case against Telugu actress Dimple Hayathi and her husband, David, for allegedly harassing their 22-year-old domestic help. The complainant reported repeated abuse, denial of food, and threats. David reportedly smashed her mobile phone when she attempted to record their abusive behavior, leading to charges under various BNS sections.

title: Who is Vishal Brahma? Actor arrested in Chennai for smuggling drugs worth Rs 40 cr
content: Actor Vishal Brahma, known for his role in 'Student of the Year 2', was reportedly arrested at Chennai airport by DRI. He stands accused of trafficking methaqualone worth Rs 40 crore, allegedly lured by a Nigerian drug syndicate. Brahma, returning from Singapore, reportedly needed money and was instructed to carry the contraband.

title: 'If you make…'- Ex-India cricketer gives huge warning ahead of Test series
content: Former India cricketer Aakash Chopra advised against preparing rank turner pitches for the upcoming Test series against West Indies, warning they could be counterproductive by reducing the competitive gap. He advocated for balanced surfaces that allow matches to progress naturally over four to five days, noting how extreme pitches have negatively impacted senior Indian batsmen's confidence and performance.

title: Banks to be closed on several days in October; check state-wise holiday list
content: October 2025 will bring numerous bank holidays across India. Banks will close for various festivals including Dussehra, Diwali, and Chhath Puja. A nationwide closure occurs on October 2 for Mahatma Gandhi Jayanti.

title: Internationalisation of Rupees: RBI announces slew measures - All you need to know
content: The Reserve Bank of India has announced significant measures to elevate the rupee's global role, permitting cross-border lending in INR to Bhutan, Nepal, and Sri Lanka, and expanding the use of Special Rupee Vostro Accounts. These initiatives aim to lessen US dollar dependence, supported by India's strong economic fundamentals, including a moderated current account deficit and robust forex reserves.

title: Neck-deep water, no fear: Flooded Mathura underpass poses danger; cop rescues family trapped in car
content: Relentless rainfall paralyzed Mathura, causing widespread waterlogging and exposing civic lapses. A traffic policeman, Kuldeep Malik, bravely rescued a family from a submerged car under a railway bridge. This incident sparked admiration for the officer but also criticism of the city's unpreparedness and failed drainage system.

title: Karur stampede: Special teams formed to arrest TVK’s Anand, CTR; anticipatory bail plea filed
content: Three special teams have been formed to arrest TVK general secretary Bussy Anand and deputy general secretary CTR Nirmal Kumar following a stampede at a rally that killed 41. Police accuse them of mismanagement and deliberate delays, while the two leaders have sought anticipatory bail from the Madras High Court.

title: 'I Love Mohammad' row: Cong MP Imran Masood put under house arrest
content: Congress MP Imran Masood was placed under house arrest in Saharanpur, preventing his visit to violence-hit Bareilly. Tensions escalated there following protests over an 'I Love Muhammad' poster, leading to stone-pelting and police action. Authorities detained 50 individuals, including cleric Maulana Tauqeer Raza Khan, as CM Yogi Adityanath ordered strict measures. Security remains heightened with Section 144 imposed.

title: R Madhavan shares ultimate parenting advice to raise disciplined, successful kids
content: Actor R Madhavan reveals parenting advice from his Canadian host mother, back from his college days and one that he still applies on his son, Vedaant. He applies this principle, providing his son Vedaant with purpose and routine to avoid negative influences. This approach, supported by research, suggests structured engagement and meaningful tasks help children thrive and reduce risky behaviour.

title: Teenage sensation! Vaibhav Suryavanshi smashes century; record vs Aus U-19
content: Vaibhav Suryavanshi, the 14-year-old prodigy, recently smashed 113 runs in a Youth Test against Australia U-19, following his record-breaking career sixes in Youth ODIs. He previously became the youngest Ranji Trophy debutant and IPL contract earner, where he scored a sensational 38-ball 101. Suryavanshi continues to rewrite cricket's record books across formats.

title: Northern lights and Autumn star shine this week; when and where to see
content: The night sky promises a spectacular week with heightened Northern Lights activity following the fall equinox, offering prime viewing in high-latitude regions like Canada and Scotland. Additionally, the bright 'Autumn Star,' Fomalhaut, will be visible in the southern sky on October 3. Skywatchers should seek clear, dark locations for optimal viewing of these celestial events.

title: 'Will be given to some guy': Trump pushes for Nobel, calls denial of prize an ‘insult'
content: US President Donald Trump stated he deserves the Nobel Peace Prize for resolving seven global conflicts, deeming its absence an "insult" to the nation. He expects to resolve the Israel-Hamas conflict with his 20-point plan, potentially bringing his tally to eight.

title: Stock market holiday: Will NSE, BSE remain closed on October 2?
content: Indian stock markets will remain closed on October 2 for Gandhi Jayanti and Dussehra, with trading resuming Friday. October features 11 market holidays, including key Diwali dates. Ahead of the RBI policy, markets showed recovery in early trade, though the Sensex had dropped 3.30% over the past eight days.

title: Trump admin’s last-ditch effort fails; US govt shuts down – Why it matters
content: The US federal government has shut down, the first in nearly seven years, after Senate Democrats blocked a Republican funding bill. This impasse, driven by deep partisan divisions over spending and healthcare, leaves hundreds of thousands of federal employees furloughed and disrupts many government operations, with significant economic and public impacts.

title: India-US ties: Trump reposts PM Modi's post on Gaza peace plan
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi endorsed US President Donald Trump's 20-point Gaza peace plan, hailing it as a viable path to lasting stability for Palestinian and Israeli people. Trump, alongside Israeli PM Netanyahu, unveiled the initiative, proposing an immediate ceasefire and hostage release.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 rises above 24,700; BSE Sensex jumps 500 points
content: Stock market today: Positive global market sentiment and reduced crude oil prices encouraged local investors to engage in value buying across sectors, according to market participants.

title: Mortar shell defused along LoC in J&K’s Rajouri
content: The shell is believed to have landed in the village from across the border during cross-border shelling during Operation Sindoor in May

title: India welcome to collect Asia Cup trophy from me at ACC office in Dubai: Mohsin Naqvi
content: In a post on X, Mr. Naqvi rejected reports claiming that he, at the ACC AGM on Tuesday (September 30), apologised to BCCI officials for his actions at the presentation ceremony

title: Bareilly violence: 2 'outsiders' with criminal history nabbed after gunfight with police
content: District Magistrate Avinash Singh on Wednesday (October 1) said nearly 80 accused have been identified in the case, and arms licences of half a dozen people are being cancelled.

title: Dowry cases rise by 14% in 2023; over 6,100 women killed: NCRB
content: Uttar Pradesh again topped the chart with 2,122 deaths, followed by Bihar with 1,143. Dowry was listed as the motive in 833 murder cases across the country in 2023

title: Civic notice to school for 'ban' on religious, cultural symbols
content: The controversy erupted after some parents raised objections over students being prohibited from wearing 'tilak' or 'tikli' (bindi) on their foreheads, bangles, and rakhi or sacred threads.

title: 150 years of national song ‘Vande Mataram’ to be celebrated across India: Union Cabinet
content: According to the ‘India.Gov’ portal, ‘Vande Mataram’ was composed in Sanskrit by Bankimchandra Chatterji.

title: Rajesh Agrawal takes charge as Commerce Secretary
content: Rajesh Agrawal was the chief negotiator for the India-U.S. Bilateral Trade Agreement, Indo-Pacific Economic Forum, India-Australia CECA, and review of the ASEAN FTA

title: Cabinet hikes wheat MSP by ₹160 per quintal to ₹2,585
content: The MSP has been decided based on the recommendations of the Commission for Agricultural Costs and Prices (CACP), says Information and Broadcasting Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw

title: Congress did protest Rahul death threat, CPI(M) ministers 'mistaken': LoP Satheesan
content: Satheesan said that the threat by the BJP leader, Printu Mahadevan, was made on a news channel on September 26

title: Centre hikes Dearness Allowance/Dearness Relief by 3%; to benefit 1.18 crore employees, pensioners
content: The DA/DR increase of 3% over the existing rate of 55% of the basic pay/pension to compensate against the price rise is effective July 1, 2025

title: Former Punjab Minister Anil Joshi joins Congress
content: Anil Joshi’s joining came days after he met Congress leader Rahul Gandhi and party general secretary (organisation) K.C. Venugopal in Delhi

title: Ennore building collapse: PMK demands inquiry, seeks compensation for victims
content: The building, under construction at the Ennore Thermal Power Station in North Chennai, collapsed on September 30, claiming the lives of nine migrant workers, all hailing from Assam

title: TVK postpones Vijay’s Saturday rallies in the wake of Karur stampede
content: In a social media update, the party’s official handle pointed out to the Karur tragedy and said “we are in anguish and regret over the loss of 41 of our brethren”

title: No proposal to levy charges on UPI transactions: RBI Governor Malhotra
content: The Governor said the central bank is examining a proposal to allow lenders to remotely lock mobile phones bought on credit in case of default in EMI payments

title: Prashant Kishor's Jan Suraaj Party submits memorandum to Bihar Governor for Deputy CM's removal
content: A delegation of the fledgling party, headed by national president Uday Singh and State unit chief Manoj Bharti, visited Raj Bhavan late Tuesday evening

title: Police detain Congress MP, SP MLA at house to prevent from visiting Bareilly
content: The two leaders were scheduled to travel to the city by an early morning train to meet some police officers, but were confined to their residences

title: Arunachal Pradesh Congress demands apology from BJP over 'death threat' to Rahul Gandhi
content: "This is not just an irresponsible remark, but a criminal act of intimidation," APCC president Bosiram Siram said

title: How to attract birds, butterflies and other beings? - Experts suggest measures as HYDRAA rejuvenates Hyderabad’s lakes
content: People working towards documenting and restoration of biodiversity, urged authorities undertaking lake rejuvenation to take proactive measures to restore biodiversity

title: India wasted opportunity to give befitting reply to Pakistan after Pahalgam terror attack: Owaisi
content: Asaduddin Owaisi says an atmosphere of war had prevailed as drones launched by Pakistan hovered over the western borders from Gujarat to Kashmir

title: PM Modi's silence on atrocities in Gaza 'total betrayal' of what India has stood for: Congress
content: "Where is the accountability for the genocide that has been carried out in Gaza over the past twenty months?" Jairam Ramesh said

title: Odisha districts on alert as IMD forecasts heavy rain owing to low pressure over Bay of Bengal
content: Fishermen have been advised not to venture into the sea along and off the Odisha coast during October 1 to October 4

title: Contractor booked in building collapse incident at Ennore SEZ thermal power project
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Chief Minister M.K. Stalin expressed grief over the incident; the nine victims hail from Assam

title: Major General G. Srinivas, who oversaw logistics in Operation Sindoor, takes charge as CDM Commandant
content: Before his appointment, Major General Srinivas was entrusted with the planning and execution of operational logistics in the Western Command theatre, including during the recent Operation Sindoor

title: Mid-air scuffle with Uttar Pradesh MLA lands passenger in police custody
content: The incident happened on Air India flight when MLA Rakesh Pratap Singh objected to a passenger, Samad Ali, allegedly using foul language while talking on the phone

title: Police close probe into stone attack on Anil Deshmukh; leader alleges pressure
content: The former Maharashtra Home Minister claimed the police were under pressure and the incident was being given a political colour

title: Zubeen Garg’s manager, Singapore festival organiser arrested from NCR, remanded to 14 days’ police custody
content: The two were flown to Guwahati and taken to the residence of the chief judicial magistrate concerned, as the courts are closed due to the Durga Puja holiday

title: Conflict-hit Manipur logged over 6,200 arson cases in 2023, 45% of India’s total
content: The sharp rise in arson cases in 2023 aligns with the widespread destruction recorded during the ethnic conflict that year in the State

title: Charge sheet filed against rapper Vedan and others for ‘ganja’ consumption
content: The accused have been charged under the Narcotics Drugs and Psychotropic Substances Act and they were let off on bail after their arrest

title: RSS general secretary hails “unwavering” public support for the Sangh through its 100-year journey
content: The Sangh consistently sought consensus on matters of Hindu unity, national security, social harmony, democracy, and preservation of culture, says Mr. Hosabale, adding that acceptance grew steadily over time

title: Speculating on ‘Kathipara’
content: ‘The entire area has a lot of streets that have Army connotations — Lashkarkhana (a camp), Asarghana (Afsar Khana or Officer’s Enclave), Butt Road (there was a rifle practice butt here), Magazine Road, North Parade, etc.’

title: When 50 people died in two Sunday stampedes in Chennai
content: The deaths of 50 people in two stampedes, both of which occurred on Sundays, in Chennai, 20 years ago, would illustrate how lessons in crowd management are rarely learned

title: Two police constables arrested for raping young woman in Tiruvannamalai
content: The 19-year-old survivor, who hails from Andhra Pradesh, was picked up by the duo after stopping the truck she was travelling in for checking documents

title: Browns bench Flacco, turn to Gabriel as starter
content: The Browns are benching Joe Flacco and will turn to rookie Dillon Gabriel as their starting QB for Sunday's game against the Vikings.

title: Boone defends pulling Fried as Yanks fumble lead
content: Yankees manager Aaron Boone's in-game decisions were under the microscope yet again after his bullpen failed to protect a 1-0 lead in a 3-1 loss to the Red Sox in Game 1.

title: WNBA players support Collier in ripping league
content: Players across the WNBA supported Napheesa Collier after she ripped WNBA leadership in her exit interview Tuesday.

title: Mitchell exits with cramping as Fever's run ends
content: Fever star Kelsey Mitchell left Tuesday's Game 5 loss to the Aces in the third quarter because of lower-body cramping.

title: Dodgers win behind dominant Snell, HR barrage
content: Blake Snell dominated in his Dodgers postseason debut, allowing just two runs in seven innings, and Teoscar Hernandez and Shohei Ohtani each homered twice as the Dodgers beat Cincinnati 10-5 on Tuesday night to put them one win away from the NLDS.

title: Aces ride 'twisty, windy' road back to WNBA Finals
content: A'ja Wilson scored 35 points and Jackie Young had 32 to lead the Aces back to the WNBA Finals as Las Vegas held off pesky Indiana in the deciding Game 5.

title: Saleh rues 'wrong choice of words' in Coen spat
content: San Francisco 49ers defensive coordinator Robert Saleh told reporters on Tuesday that he "could have found a better choice of words" during his argument with Jacksonville coach Liam Coen on Sunday, following the Jaguars' 26-21 victory at Levi's Stadium.

title: Kuminga, Warriors end stalemate with 2-year deal
content: Jonathan Kuminga and the Warriors ended a monthslong stalemate Tuesday, reaching agreement on a two-year deal worth $48.5 million.

content: Who should be the next captain for Team USA? How can Scottie Scheffler turn around his Ryder Cup record? We answer some of the biggest questions facing the U.S. ahead of 2027.

title: How one city’s tragedy birthed a standard for a championship years in the making
content: For 30 years, the Oklahoma City bombing -- the most devastating act of homegrown terrorism in history -- has been seared into the identity of the city. Since 2008, the Thunder have been trying to honor it -- and give the fans a new one.

content: Roman Reigns joined The Usos at Raw. It was his first time in a WWE ring since being stretchered off at Clash of Paris in August.

content: Merab Dvalishvili, the UFC champion Dana White once called "next-level stupid," is slowly taking over the internet.

title: Cough Syrup Kills 2 Children In Rajasthan; Doctor Takes It To Prove It's Safe And Faints
content: A generic cough syrup manufactured by a pharmaceutical company for the Rajasthan government has led to the deaths of two children and at least 10 others falling ill in the state over the past two weeks, officials said.

title: Dowry Cases Rise By 14% In 2023, Over 6,100 Women Killed: Data
content: Cases registered under dowry-related crimes saw a 14 per cent increase in 2023, with more than 15,000 cases recorded across the country and over 6,100 deaths reported through the year, according to the latest report of the NCRB

title: Opinion: Opinion | India-Pak Asia Cup Row: War, Minus The Shooting
content: George Orwell called sport "War Minus The Shooting" in an essay on sporting spirit, where he said that competitive sports trigger intense nationalistic rivalries and aggression. I am just wondering if that could be called "War PLUS the shooting" now.

title: Meet India's Youngest Billionaire. His Net Worth Is Rs 21,190 Crore
content: Aravind Srinivas, the 31-year-old Chennai-born AI entrepreneur, has entered the M3M Hurun India Rich List 2025 as the country's youngest billionaire.

title: 'Trumps Tariffs, Crackdown On Immigration To Hold Back US Growth': Economist
content: Harvard University economist Kenneth Rogoff on Wednesday said the high tariffs on several countries, including India, and the steep H-1B visa fee hike imposed by the Trump administration will hold back the US economic growth.

title: 16-Year-Old Allegedly Forced Into Marriage In Bengaluru, Case Filed: Cops
content: A case was registered in connection with an incident where a 16-year-old girl was allegedly forced into marriage at a mosque in Anepalya here recently, police said on Wednesday.

title: No Flying School In India Gets Top Rating, 22 Out Of 35 Ranked 'C'
content: Aviation regulator DGCA has come out with its first-ever ranking of flying training organisations in the country, and none of the 35 organisations in the list have managed to get top ratings of 'A' and 'A'.

title: Opinion: Opinion | The Difference Between Trump And Jaishankar At United Nations
content: In its conduct, the UN seems caught in the quintessential cleft stick - a dependence on world's major powers and economies for its funding but a promise to the world to be democratic and unbiased.

title: Disarmament, Expulsion: Clauses In Trump's Plan That Hamas Wants Amended
content: Hamas officials want amendments to clauses in US President Donald Trump's Gaza peace plan including on disarmament, a Palestinian source close to the group's leadership told AFP.

title: Magadh Gains Maximum Voters, Seemanchal Loses Most In Bihar List Revision
content: Bihar's Magadh region, which includes Patna, has seen the highest voter addition rate, and the minority-dominated Seemanchal region has recorded the highest voter deletion rate in the Special Intensive Revision of voter lists

title: 'Vote Chori' A Sham: BJP Slams Rahul Gandhi Over Bihar's Final Voter List
content: The BJP has launched a scathing attack on the Congress after the Election Commission published the final voter roll for Bihar following the Special Intensive Revision

title: Taiwan Now Biggest Importer Of This Crude Oil Product From Russia, India Is Second
content: Taiwan, the United States' most effective bulwark in Asia against Chinese diplomatic and military pressure, has become the world's biggest importer of Russian naphtha, a petroleum derivative used in the semiconductor industry.

title: Russia Wants India In Arctic Council To Navigate Northern Sea Route
content: Russia is avidly courting India for an Arctic power play in the 'Northern Sea Route' with an Arctic Council Membership on the table.

title: Russia's Vladimir Putin Likely To Visit India On December 5-6, To Meet PM Modi
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin is set to arrive in India on December 5-6 for a summit with Prime Minister Narendra Modi, as ties between the countries grow closer after the US imposed punitive tariffs on New Delhi over its purchases Russian oil.

title: "Such Tragedies Are Totally Avoidable": Kiran Bedi To NDTV On Karur Stampede
content: 41 people were killed and over 60 were injured in Saturday's stampede in Karur, where Vijay was campaigning for his Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam (TVK) party.

title: Netflix Sees Spike In Subscription Cancellations: Here's Why
content: Netflix is experiencing a surge in subscription cancellations over its animated series Dead End: Paranormal Park and controversial remarks by the show's creator, Hamish Steele.

title: Taliban Denies Internet Ban, Blames Blackout On 'Decaying' Infrastructure
content: The Taliban government on Wednesday rejected reports of a nationwide internet ban in Afghanistan, saying old fiber optic cables are worn out and are being replaced.

title: Unlike The Rest Of India, This UP Village Worships Ravana On Dussehra
content: While the country gears up to burn towering Ravana effigies on October 2, a village in Uttar Pradesh observes Dussehra in a unique way. The locals here worship Ravana, the demon king from the epic Ramayana.

title: RBI Governor Says No Proposal To Levy Charges On UPI Transactions
content: Reserve Bank Governor Sanjay Malhotra on Wednesday said there is no proposal to levy any charge on UPI transactions.

title: When an industrialist’s saree giveaway at Palani ended in stampede on Gandhi Jayanthi
content: Late at night in 1993 chaos broke out with everyone in the crowd wanting to grab the sarees. In the melee many elderly women fell down leading to a stampede that killed 12 women

title: Punjab seeks special package for flood damages; Centre says it stands shoulder to shoulder with people of Punjab
content: The relief of ₹1,600 crore announced by the Centre is miniscule in the wake of the grave loss suffered by Punjab, says CM Mann

title: Commission for quacks: How private hospitals in Telangana profit from unqualified practitioners
content: The practice of unqualified medical practitioners operating so-called ‘first aid centres’ has been rampant in Telangana for decades.

title: ED searches Reliance Infrastructure premises on charges of FEMA violation
content: In a statement Reliance Infrastructure clarified that the survey was relating to a matter dating back 15 years.

title: RSS should continue to focus on nation-building for next 100 years, says former Congress MP Karan Singh
content: Though Mr. Singh’s stance is at odds with the Congress’s official position on the RSS, the party has not issued any statement or clarification

title: Over 60 lakh hectares of farms hit by rains, have sought relief from Centre, says CM Fadnavis
content: Maharashtra CM seeks relief package for flood-affected farmland, rejects “wet drought” term, promises aid before Deepavali

title: Karur stampede: What triggered the chaos
content: The stampede at an overcrowded roadshow held by Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam founder and actor Vijay occurred due to poor planning and leadership

title: Uttarakhand police forms SIT to probe journalist Rajiv Pratap’s death
content: The journalist's family has alleged that he had been receiving threats following some of his news reports; journalists' organisations have also demanded a thorough probe into the circumstances of his death.

title: Wangchuk served NSA detention order: Ladakh administration
content: It accused the climate activist of suggesting “self-immolation” to people of Ladakh on “multiple occasions” on “lines of protests in Tibet”

title: Telangana logged 10,580 suicides in 2023, says NCRB
content: Family problems were cited as the predominant trigger for suicides in Telangana, claiming 4,680 lives, or 44.2% of the State’s total cases

title: Civil society groups, activists demand Wangchuk’s release
content: Addressing a press conference, Gitanjali Angmo, Mr. Wangchuk’s wife, said she had not been able to contact her husband, nor had the police provided her a copy of the NSA order yet.

title: Tamil Nadu seeks review of Supreme Court judgment directing teachers to qualify for TET or quit service
content: If the directions are implemented, the entire school system faces the imminent prospect of collapse, with mass disqualification of teachers and denial of classroom instruction to millions of children. This creates a direct conflict with Article 21A of the Constitution, which guarantees the fundamental right to education, Tamil Nadu argues in Supreme Court

title: Lorry topples on Chennai-Bengaluru Highway in Ambur
content: Police said the lorry was proceeding towards Koyambedu Wholesale market in Chennai from Bengaluru to deliver a consignment of onions when the driver suddenly lost control of the vehicle.

title: Maharashtra, Karnataka report most number of farmer suicides
content: Removing import restrictions, succumbing to ‘tariff terrorism’ will worsen the situation, warns Kisan Sabha

title: Bihar had just five Passport and Foreigners Act cases in 2023: NCRB report
content: Illegal migration and infiltration have been raised as key issues ahead of the Bihar polls; according to NCRB data, in 2023, most of the cases pertaining to laws governing foreigners were registered in Bengal, followed by Tripura, Maharashtra, Tamil Nadu and Punjab

title: BJP moves to consolidate votes in Bihar, to pull out Madhya Pradesh playbook
content: Bhojpuri singer Pawan Singh, whose independent candidacy led to NDA’s defeat in Karakat in 2024 Lok Sabha elections, has been pulled back into the party fold. The party is also planning to field many senior leaders, including Union Ministers, in the Assembly polls as it did in Madhya Pradesh

title: U.P. PGT exam postponed again; aspirants, Opposition slam government’s repeated delays
content: Students allege that this is the fifth time the examination, whose notification was released in April 2022, has been postponed, citing unavoidable reasons

title: Karnataka tops civic negligence deaths, says NCRB data
content: Civic negligence in Karnataka leads to 23 deaths in 2023, highlighting systemic issues and lack of accountability

title: Indian Railways to launch first assured-transit container train from Delhi to Kolkata in October
content: The bi-weekly service will run from Inland Container Depot (ICD) Tughlakabad in Delhi, to CONCOR’s CTCS terminal in Kolkata via Agra and Kanpur.

title: CM says some journalists are acting as a catspaw of their corporate owners
content: Corporate-controlled media is pursuing an aggressive news agenda that sought to divide the country along religious lines to obfuscate the livelihood issues plaguing the people

title: Over 3,000 students in Tirupattur mourn Karur stampede
content: According to a press release, students also took a pledge for their commitment to safety and observed a moment of silence in a tribute to the departed

title: U.P. Police initiate demolition action against properties linked to Bareilly cleric’s aide
content: 16 rioters who attacked the police in Bareilly with bricks, stones, and bottles of acid were arrested by the police

title: Bridging the fighter jet gap is top priority: IAF Deputy Chief
content: We are looking at the LCA Mk2 and have also invested in the Advanced Medium Combat Aircraft, which represents the future of indigenous combat platforms. However, these projects will take time to mature. In the immediate future, we need to bridge the capability gap

title: Kerala Govt. receives nearly 18,000 petitions during human-wildlife conflict mitigation programme
content: Second phase of programme will commence on October 1. Over the next four days, the complaints will be categorised, following which district-level meetings, chaired by the Minister in-charge of districts, will be held

title: FIR filed against Maharashtra Congress over social media post
content: Mumbai Police registers FIR against unidentified person for allegedly inciting violence through social media post showing BJP office on fire amidst protests

title: After controversy, CJI Bhushan Gavai’s mother undecided on being chief guest at RSS event
content: The Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh had extended an invite to Kamala Gavai for its Vijayadasami celebration which will be held in Amravati on October 5

title: India got 8% more monsoon rain this year
content: While northern India saw extremely heavy spells, causing loss of life and property, east and northeast regions got lesser rain than usual
